TopicTitle: how to play old versions of ksp

Articles.Content:
How do i play early versions of ksp? I want to see how the game was years ago and well do what everyone does kill kerbals. And find glitches to play around with. Oh I use steam.

Edited October 29, 2016 by Program Kerbal Space

There's a stickied thread right at the top of this forum that has download links to really old versions, up to 0.13.3. You can freely download those.

Now, there were around 15 or so versions in between that and now. You cannot obtain those anymore. As far as Squad is concerned, they no longer exist. Asking for access to them will get your thread locked, so don't bother trying!

However, since you use Steam, you have a limited ability to go backwards one or two releases. In your Steam games library, find KSP, rightclick, properties. Go to the "Betas" tab, and in the dropdown menu, you can check what's available. Right now, you can find 1.1.3 and 1.0.5 there. Note that this will overwrite your 1.2 installation unless you manually back that up first. (KSP can still start just fine via the executeable file if you simply copy&paste the folder from your Steam library to somewhere else.)

 

Hope that helps
